intro: Delima piripu, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with slender, branching stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom throughout the summer months. Delima piripu is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal remedies.
